value.0: Hail to ye!  <Sir/Madam>, you're a welcome sight.  As you can imagine we don't see many people up this way.

Alright.  Remember ye need 3 things.  Fafnir's Armor, Mithril Ore, and 30 million gold.  Be aware that with my enhancements the armor will be usable only by those who have great strength*.

*30 Base Strength
Ye ain't got my anvil!
Blessed day!

Thank ye.  Now I can help ye too... but it'll require three things.  The armor of the mighty dwarf Fafnir, a bar of mithril ore, and 30 million gold.  Also be aware the armor I upgrade will require you possess a bit of real strength*.  More than one sad mage have I seen crumble under it.

*30 Base Strength
Ye haven't got any letter...
Let me see.
I thank ye.  I would love to help ye in return but me anvil was stolen.  I heard once that it fell to the hands of the Duergars, but I can't be sure.
Why <lad/lass>, I am Brigron.  Long ago my Kin ruled this land, our kingdom stretched from Blackwell to Evrathost.

We mined the purest mithril in the land!  Our people thrived.  We traded with the Humans and Elves alike.  Our blades and armor were the only weapons that could hold the full power of the Elves Mystic Forge!
Hammers Deep, the great dwarven stronghold was lost from within.  A young dwarf named Fafnir, who's hunger for power was only exceeded by his thirst for gold, brought it to its knees.

Soon the humans refused to trade and the elves cut off all communication.  I and my Kin escaped from Hammers Deep in hopes to return later to end Fafnir's reign.  Unfortunately for us, my brother Gribigron was lost to us in the escape.  Without his knowledge of the forge we dare not cross blades with our cousins.

Evrathost, is Elven land.  The last foothold of that people on this continent.  It lies at the tip of the peninsula.  We have tried to reach the Elves and get some weapons from them, but the Elves have long ago cut off all ways to the elven lands. . .all ways except. . .perhaps. . . the portal at Hammers Deep.

Yes, a portal built in friendship, a portal for trade.  In the treaty, the Elves agreed to always keep it open.  Fafnir would not risk violating that.  It is in the upper hall of Hammers Deep.  It must be there still.
Go to the Southwest through Stone Valley.
Fafnir is an evil greedy dwarf.  Some say he was cursed by the gods for his greed, for he can assume the form of the only creature as greedy as himself, a Dragon.
Ye, might get one off the body of a Stonebloodman, otherwise you would need ore and someone to forge it.

<Lad/Lass>, I have little hope that anything can be done.  You could kill Fafnir, you could route the Stonebloods.  Hah, and while your at it why not crush the armies of hell and pull the Terasque from his den by his tail.
I have some armor I would like to upgrade.
OK, I will be back.
I have those items, I'm ready.
I have your anvil.
<StartAction>[Hand over the anvil.]</Start>
I'll be back.
OK, I have all that.  I'm ready.
I have seen your brother Gribigorn.  He game me this letter for you.
<StartAction>[Keep the letter.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Hand over the letter.]</Start>
I will try to find it...
Who are you and why do you live in such a hostile place?
Go on.
What happened?
[continue]
End
What is Evrathost?
A portal at Hammers Deep?
Only one way to find out.
Where is Hammers Deep?
Back
What can you tell me about Fafnir?
Back
How do I get one of those Dwarven weapons?
How can I help?
Back
